articles.title: Climate Change Lengthening Pollen Season in U.S., Study Shows - The New York Times
articles.description: New research suggests that climate change is responsible for longer pollen seasons in the United States and more pollen in the air, as well.
articles.content:
The worlds a messy place, Dr. Anderegg said, with many potentially confounding influences, but the really strong signal here, and the attribution to climate change, is compelling.

articles.description: At 10 a.m. Tuesday, the state of Iowa reported a total of 5,145 COVID-19-related deaths and 325,379 confirmed cases of coronavirus.
articles.content:
